description: Values of n for which exp(Pi*sqrt(n)) is very close to an integer.
comments: Very close is defined here as being less than 1/100.e^(Pi*sqrt(163)) is 262537412640768743.9999999999992500725971981856888... and no closer exponent of this character has been discovered. See A069014.
prog: (Contribution from _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 26 2014) (Start)/* Adjusting the p-value allows one to select more interesting subsequences. */(PARI) is_A019296(n,p=2)=abs(frac(exp(sqrt(n)*Pi))-.5)>.5-.1^p(PARI) {p=.5-.1^2; for(n=1,9e9,abs(frac(exp(sqrt(n)*Pi))-.5)>p&&print1(round(exp(sqrt(n)*Pi))",")) \\ (End)
author: Roy Williams Clickery (roy(AT)ccsf.caltech.edu)
extensions: Edited and extended by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 07 2003
